text: Richard "Dick" Abernathy was a college football player. ==Vanderbilt University== Abernathy was a prominent end for Dan McGugin's Vanderbilt Commodores of Vanderbilt University from 1927 and 1929. ===1928=== In 1928, Abernathy began the season with two touchdown catches against Chattanooga in a 20–0 win. He also caught a 38–yard touchdown pass that helped Vanderbilt defeat Colgate 12–7. In Dallas, Abernathy blocked a punt that was recovered in the end zone. The resulting touchdown gave the Commodores' a 13–12 win over Texas. At year's end he was selected All-American. ==Chautauqua== Abernathy advertised Redpath Chautauqua. ==References== Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing Category:American football ends Category:Vanderbilt Commodores football players Category:All-Southern college football players Category:All-American college football players
title: Dick Abernathy
